Posts.Content: Hello Mandymuff, Thanks for the nice reply reassuring members that it becomes easier and eventually second nature. Posts.Title: Inspire's Amazing Ability To Share In Multiple Groups

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone, For all the new members regardless of just how new and may not be aware of Inspire's ability to join multiple groups. What separates Inspire from all other support networks or groups is the ability for its members to join multiple groups and to share their posts to the multiple groups relevant to their medical needs. Inspire has over 200 support communities with just about any type of diagnosis one may have. Many of us have multiple medical issues and from time to time may need help from some or all their groups they have joined. Navigating through this amazing network may be awkward for those who don't know. I know it was for me many years ago. I had already joined multiple groups but eventually had to ask someone how to share to multiple groups. There are two ways to post which I find a little trickier since Inspire's upgrade. When clicking in the box for posting it will bring you to what looks much like a file folder with tabs at the top left corner. There you will see "Discussion Entry" and "Journal Entry." I didn't notice these tabs in the top left corner at first my eyes just caught the large print. That's one reason I mentioned that its a little trickier because members may not notice the tabs like me. "Discussion Entry" only allows a member to post in one group at a time regardless of how many groups one belongs to. "Journal Entry" provided a member has joined more than one group then "Journals" allows someone to choose from their groups they would like their post to be shared in. They can choose ALL or some of their groups. Here's the other tricky part for new members. It used to be we had a box before each group where we click on to share in which was not confusing. Now there is a large box that a member needs click in for their list of groups to show up below the box. Then click on the group which will be transferred into the box while causing your list of groups to disappear. Each time you want to add another group you have to click in the box to show your list of groups, then choose another group to be added to the box. Keep repeating until all the groups you desire have been placed into the box. Remember there is a tiny box above the big box that allows one to click on "ALL" groups. If for some reason the "ALL" button disappears then you will have to do it manually with the click and choose method. It's very important to notice and decide how you want your post to be shared Public, Members, or Inspire Friends. By clicking in the box that says Public it will display "shared with" and displays Public, Members, and Inspire friends. If you Don't want to share with the public then you have to choose either Members or Inspire friends which are eventually acquired as time goes on. Sometimes a post may be very sensitive and to be able to receive more comments then you should choose "Shared with Members." There are some members who do not like their comments shared with the Public so make sure to click in the small box and choose "Members" otherwise it will automatically be shared with public. If you decide later to change your post from Public to Members then it's easy, just click on "edit" at the top just above your writing , scroll down until you see the small box with public and change itto members, then hit "save." However, some posts such as this one which has no sensitive points is OK to "Share with Public." I often think about how I found this site which would not have been possible on the internet if someone hadn't posted "Public." Inspire also offers the ability to share up to 4 pictures at a time by clicking on the camera and browse your photos to share with Inspire. Then you can scroll down to "Post." Forgot to share in a single group and had to edit to do it manually. Click & choose, Click & choose until all done, HeHeHe. Sorry for the long post. Hope This helps Errol Edited October 8, 2018 at 2:04 am
